label: Growth Journal
question: I want students to engage and speak more in class
content: Ask students to maintain a growth mindset journal throughout the semester. Instruct them to write about challenges they face, mistakes they make, and what they learned from those experiences. Encourage them to reflect on how these challenges and mistakes contribute to their personal and academic growth. Allocate regular class time for students to share their journal entries and engage in group discussions, fostering a positive learning environment.

label: Failure Reflection Circle
question: I want students to learn from their mistakes on exams and assignments
content: Organize a group activity where students form a circle and share their most memorable failures or mistakes in their academic or personal lives. Emphasize that mistakes are valuable learning opportunities. Each student should discuss how their failures have influenced their personal growth, shaped their character, or led to unexpected positive outcomes. Encourage classmates to provide support, ask questions, and share their own experiences.

label: Challenge Day
question: I want students to complete all assignments (purpose and course structure)
content: Designate a specific class session as a "Challenge Day." Divide students into small groups and provide them with a complex problem or task relevant to the course material. Emphasize that the focus is not solely on finding the correct answer but on the process of tackling the challenge. Encourage students to experiment, make mistakes, and learn from them. Facilitate group discussions afterward to highlight the value of perseverance and the benefits of embracing challenges.

label: Mistake Showcase
question: I want students to come to course more frequently
content: Encourage students to celebrate their mistakes as learning opportunities. Allocate time during class for students to create visual representations or presentations that showcase their most significant mistakes in the course. Each student should explain what they learned from the mistake and how it has contributed to their overall learning and growth. Display the presentations in the classroom or share them digitally to foster a supportive learning community.

label: Reflection Buddies
question: I want students to feel welcome in my course
content: Assign students reflection buddies, pairing them up with a classmate. Throughout the semester, students should meet with their reflection buddy to discuss challenges they have encountered and the mistakes they have made. Encourage open and honest conversations, emphasizing that mistakes are an integral part of the learning process. Students can exchange advice, strategies, and insights to support each other's growth mindset development.

label: Learning Journey Timeline
question: I want students to use available resources (office hours, student centers etc.)
content: Instruct students to create a visual timeline of their learning journey in the course. Ask them to mark significant challenges, setbacks, and mistakes they encountered along the way. In addition to these markers, they should include descriptions of what they learned from each experience and how it shaped their understanding and growth. Students can present their timelines to the class, fostering an appreciation for the learning that arises from challenges and mistakes.

label: Expert Failure Panel
question: I want students to use more effective study strategies
content: Invite guest speakers, such as professionals or alumni, who have experienced significant setbacks or failures in their careers. Organize a panel discussion where these experts share their stories and discuss the lessons they learned from their failures. Encourage students to actively engage by asking questions and seeking advice on how to view challenges and mistakes as valuable opportunities for growth.

label: Constructive Feedback Workshop
question: I want students to see the relevance of the course content
content: Teach students the importance of giving and receiving constructive feedback. Assign a class project or assignment and instruct students to provide feedback to their peers. Emphasize the value of feedback in identifying areas for improvement and the opportunity to learn from mistakes. Guide students on how to provide specific, actionable feedback and encourage a supportive, growth-oriented feedback culture within the classroom.

label: Challenge Showcase
question: I want students to connect what they are learned with their future goals
content: Organize a class-wide challenge showcase event where students display their work and share the challenges they encountered during the process. This could involve projects, research papers, creative endeavors, or any other relevant coursework. Encourage students to present not only their successes but also the mistakes and difficulties they faced along the way. Celebrate the growth and learning that arises from tackling challenging tasks.

label: Mindset Shift Debate
question: I want students to feel like they are not alone when they struggle
content: Divide the class into two teams for a debate on the topic of whether challenges or mistakes are beneficial for learning and growth. Assign each team a position to argue, regardless of their personal beliefs. Encourage students to conduct research, gather evidence, and develop persuasive arguments. Through this activity, students will gain a deeper understanding of the value of challenges and mistakes, ultimately fostering a growth mindset and critical thinking skills.
